subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In Taiwan and Hong Kong, the component above <big>{{l|mul|蒦}}</big> is written with <font size=4>⻀</font> (ram's horn component), which is the orthodox form found in the {{w|Shuowen Jiezi}} ({{w2|zh|說文解字}}) and {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}.
* In mainland China (based on {{w|Xin Zixing}}, {{w2|zh|新字形}}), Japanese {{w|kanji}}, Korean {{w|hanja}} and Vietnamese {{w|History of writing in Vietnam|Nôm}}, the component above <big>{{l|mul|蒦}}</big> is written with <font size=4>{{l|mul|艹}}</font> (grass radical).
